text: Anna Benaki-Psarouda (born 12 December 1934) is a Greek lawyer, New Democracy politician and academician. She was born in Exarcheia, Athens, and obtained her PhD from the University of Bonn. She joined the Athens Bar Association and taught law. In 1981 she entered into politics and in the 1990s became culture minister then Minister of Justice. From 2004 to 2007 she served as Speaker of the Hellenic Parliament.Interview from The American College of Greece In 2010 she was elected Member of the Academy of Athens. On 7 December 2018 she was elected to serve as Vice-President of the Academy of Athens for the year 2019, and President for the year 2020, succeeding Stephanos Imellos in both offices. == References == Category:1934 births Category:Members of the Academy of Athens (modern) Category:People from Athens Category:Greek women lawyers Category:Greek MPs 2007–2009 Category:New Democracy (Greece) politicians Category:Speakers of the Hellenic Parliament Category:Culture ministers of Greece Category:Justice ministers of Greece Category:National and Kapodistrian University of Athens faculty Category:University of Bonn alumni Category:Women government ministers of Greece Category:Living people Category:21st-century women politicians Category:Female justice ministers Category:20th-century Greek lawyers Category:20th-century women lawyers
title: Anna Benaki-Psarouda
